quote: I'm not expecting much work in Hollywood, to be honest. People stick to film because they tend to get offered the same roles over and over again, and it's safe. But I'm not interested in doing that.

To be honest, I think we should find first the possibility to make it. Research is first - if you're not interested, you never can find something. Many things happen from forgotten machines - ones that are no longer used.
I'm a very basic dresser. I'm not interested in calling too much attention to myself. I like to look cool without being too noticeable.
I was surprised by the response of young people because there is a perception that those younger than the 1988 generation are not interested in politics.

Most English writers are not interested in change but in the social novel. That demands a static backdrop. I'm intensely interested in change - probably as a matter of self-preservation. What the hell is going to happen next?
I am fully present wherever I am. Why bother being in a community or neighborhood and not being fully present? I think that's colonization. I'm not interested in that.
I'm not interested in culture; I'm interested in the law.
As a designer, I'm not interested in trend.
I'm not interested in pop art.
I'm not interested in offending anyone. If homosexuality was an issue for me, I would have moved out of New York years ago. I find that laughable.
I'm not interested in an imaginary world.

I think a playful critique is good for all of us, and that's basically how I see satire functioning. But I'm not interested in a kind of contemptuous satirical vision; I try always, even when I'm knowingly being satirical, to also be humane, but I mean, let's face it: there's plenty in American life to make fun of, and we all participate in it.
I'm not interested in fame at all.
I was not interested in being minister of defense or minister of foreign affairs.
I'm not interested in defending the position of those who already have money, power and privilege.

I don't necessarily go out and try to do something that's going to be just something that will please the audience. I'm not interested in doing something where I get the most people to come see the movie at the same time and they get the biggest explosion. I'm not interested in that.

I'm not interested in making horror-comedies, but I'm very interested in making scary movies with funny parts.
I don't write genre stuff in any form. I'm not interested in it. I always try to do the opposite of that.

I happen to go for the simplest, most ordinary things. The extraordinary doesn't interest me. I'm not interested in psychotics. I'm interested in the person you don't expect to have a story. I like Everyman.
Why would you watch an Oscar-nominated film unless you're mad enough to purposely experience feelings? Bleh. I'm not interested in catching those.
I'm not interested in younger men for the same reason most women aren't interested in younger men; I don't have time to make an extra packed lunch every morning. Please. I'm busy enough already.
I'm not interested in food. It's just fuel.
A lot of people are not interested in stories in which they don't see themselves.

I am not interested to sing in Bollywood. I sing for only those actors whom I admire. I sing free of cost for them. I want to take independent music ahead, and my songs are completely based on my observations.

I'm not interested in being famous. I'm interested in doing my job and doing it well, and that's wrestling, and that's what I love.
Let the historians and the Ph.D. students work out their doctrines. I'm not interested in theories per se.

I'm not interested in censorship. I like the First Amendment very much.
I'm not interested in forcing my music on people, and that's what the whole music industry nowadays is based on is forcing stations to play it, forcing people to listen to it.
Reality is a dirty word for me, I know it isn't for most people, but I am not interested. There's too much of it about.
I personally am not interested in people trying to pigeonhole me.

In 1968, 'Liberty Magazine' had an article about George Wallace in which he stated he would suggest me as a possible vice-presidential candidate, along with other choices such as 'Happy' Chandler and General Curtis LeMay. However, I am not interested in any political office in the United States or anywhere, now or back in 1968.
Criticism in good faith is good. When it's targeted solely to destruction, I'm not interested.

You can talk about capitalism and communism and all that sort of thing, but the important thing is the struggle everybody is engaged in to get better living conditions, and they are not interested too much in government.

Doctors and scientists, being part of that two-sex culture, have done everything they can to try to force people who are in-between into one of the two clear types. Intersex people themselves have also generally wanted to fit into one of the two clear categories; most are not interested in being in a 'third' type.
No, I am not interested in women or sex or anything.
I'm not interested in politics. I lose interest the microsecond it ceases to be emotional, when something becomes a political movement. What I'm interested in is emotions.

Even though I played national level badminton, I told my parents when I was in 10th that I was not interested in continuing. Being a model or actor fascinated me from a young age, and I even did a couple of ads when I was just eight years old.

I'm not interested in having an orchestra sound like itself. I want it to sound like the composer.

So I like that sound, but I am not interested in being retro.
I have often heard it said that the United States is isolated and is not interested in European affairs. I assure you that this is not the case.

Certainly, I read a lot and follow the news. But as a writer, I am not interested in a political story. I am searching for the humanity of the characters. I never set out to write a book about an 'issue.'
Many people repeat the past. I'm not interested. I prefer evolution.
Well, I am not interested in the kind of expression that you have when you paint a painting with brush strokes. It's all right, but it's already done and I want to do something new.

I am not interested in power for power's sake, but I'm interested in power that is moral, that is right and that is good.
And what's more I've got no need for anyone to tell me how to do it. I am not interested. You act how you want to and leave me alone to do my own thing.

I'm not interested in what other people are doing. That's their business.
I'm not interested in building wealth, which is kind of naive and probably frowned on, living in America. It's something that people don't necessarily understand, but if I die poor, I die poor.

I'm not interested in the past or in talking about myself.
I'm not interested in how well someone can sing. It's what you're singing that interests me.
I'm not interested in thinking up the name of a band and a logo and all that. Been there, done that, sold a million T-shirts.

I prefer to surprise myself as I'm writing. I'm not interested in it if I already know where it's going. So I have only the most general sense of what I'm doing when I start a story. I sometimes have a destination in mind, but how the story is going to go from Point A to Point Z is something I make up as I go along.
I'm not interested in stories about movie stars. I couldn't care less what Steve Martin has on his mind.
Stage-persona notwithstanding, I'm extremely shy and quiet. Almost painfully shy. People misinterpret that as being above it all or not interested.
I don't care what I look like. I must be comfortable. Some of my friends have plastic surgery and Botox, but I'm not interested in it.
I don't know what would happen to me if I ate a bacon sandwich, but I'm just not interested.
Solving specific problems is what drives me. I am not interested in having a career. I never have been.

I've never been interested in action movies. Definitely not interested in sci-fi.
I'm not interested in replicating 'Hedwig' like a virus.

I don't like sports. I'm not interested in sports. I hate sports.

I would open a page in the textbook and start thinking about everything under the sun except what was there in the book. I was more into extra-curricular activities and sports like NCC, rifle shooting, aero-modelling, bike racing, etc.

Yeah, I don't like, um, I'm not interested in rock 'n' roll piano. I find it a little grating.

Snark describes a cynical position, and I'm not interested in that.
I am not interested in splitting the white vote.
I'm not interested in on-the-job learning or on-the-job training.
Marriage, at this point in my life? I'm not interested in it. Yet. Maybe later when I'm 35 or 40.
When I first heard 'Robocop' was going to be remade. I said, 'Yeah, that's interesting. I'll probably watch that at some point, but I'm not interested at all to be in it.'

I like today and perhaps a little future still, but the past is really something I'm not interested in. So, as far as I'm concerned, I like only the past of things and people I don't know. When I know, I don't care because I knew how it was.
I wanted to make a living, but I really was not interested in money at all. I was interested in being a great comedian.

I don't know if I'm selfless - I still want to make a great record. I want to make a hit record. I want to tour; that's not completely selfless. But the truth is I'm not interested in people coming to my show for me as much as I am for them coming to my show for themselves. That's always been how I am.
I'm not interested in people positioning me next to other artists.

I have no connection with Hollywood. I'm not interested. I don't care.
I like my parents but they are just not good parents. They are nice enough people. I'm not interested in hurting their feelings.

I'm not interested in the boring parts. Everyone has tummy trouble. Everyone waits in line. I don't want to hear about it.
I want a world of peace. I'm not interested in bombs. I'm not interested in wars. I'm interested in peace.
